etymologies: late 17th century (in an earlier sense). From poly- + -scope

definitions: A type of film projector based on the same principles as Edison's Kinetoscope. Compare "kinetoscope". Now hist.

notes.text: First produced in 1896 by William Selig (1864–1948), and used by his film production company the Selig Polyscope Company until 1918.
